document.discussion_title: American Simone Manuel wins gold in women's 100 freestyle | wltx.com
document.topic_text: American Simone Manuel wins gold in women's 100 freestyle USA TODAY , KING 11:22 PM. EST August 11, 2016 Simone Manuel (USA) during the women's 100m freestyle semifinals in the Rio 2016 Summer Games. (Photo: Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN GOOGLE+ PINTEREST RIO DE JANEIRO â€” Simone Manuel won a gold medal in the women's 100 freestyle final Thursday night, surprising even herself. Her jaw dropped as she looked up to the scoreboard and saw a tie for gold and an Olympic-record time of 52.70 seconds. A FINA official confirmed that Manuel is the first African American woman to win Olympic gold in an individual event. Penny Oleksiak of Canada shared the gold. Sweden's Sarah Sjostrom won bronze. The last time an American woman won gold in the event was 1984, when Nancy Hogshead and Carrie Steinseifer also tied. This is the first tie for a gold medal since Anthony Ervin and Gary Hall Jr. did it in the 50 free in Sydney in 2000. American Abbey Weitzeil was seventh. Loading... Lilly King (USA) swims during the women's 200-meter breaststroke semifinals. Jack Gruber, USA TODAY Sports Michael Phelps (USA) and Ryan Lochte (USA) react after the men's 200-meter individual medley semifinals. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Allison Schmitt started off the women's 4x200-meter freestyle relay for the United States. MARTIN BUREAU, Custom Bronze medalist USA's Nathan Adrian on the podium of the Men's 100m Freestyle Final during the swimming event at the Rio 2016 Olympic Games at the Olympic Aquatics Stadium in Rio de Janeiro on August 10, 2016. / AFP / Martin BUREAU MARTIN BUREAU, Custom RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 10: Silver medalist Josh Prenot of the United States poses on the podium during the medal ceremony for the Men's 200m Breaststroke Final on Day 5 of the Rio 2016 Olympic Games. (Photo by Al Bello/Getty Images) Al Bello, Custom RIO DE JANEIRO, BRAZIL - AUGUST 10: Silver medalist Daryl Homer of the United States poses on the podium during the medal ceremony for the men's individual sabre on Day 5 of the Rio 2016. (Photo by Dean Mouhtaropoulos/Getty Images) Dean Mouhtaropoulos, Custom The U.S. women's gymnastics team (Aly Raisman, Madison Kocian, Laurie Hernandez, Gabby Douglas and Simone Biles) captured gold. Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY Sports Travis Stevens claimed the silver medal in men's 81kg judo. John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports Chase Kalisz claimed silver in the men's 400-meter IM. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Lilly King, right, won gold and Katie Meili took bronze in the women's 100-meter breaststroke. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Katie Ledecky won the gold medal in the women's 200-meter freestyle. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Phillip Dutton, aboard Mighty Nice, took bronze in open's individual eventing. James Lang, USA TODAY Sports Ginny Thrasher captured gold in the women's 10-meter air rifle. Geoff Burke, USA TODAY Sports The team of Conor Dwyer, Townley Haas, Ryan Lochte and Michael Phelps won the 4x200-meter freestyle relay. Kevin Jairaj, USA TODAY Sports Conor Dwyer took bronze in the men's 200-meter freestyle. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Maya DiRado claimed the bronze medal in the women's 200-meter IM. Kevin Jairaj, USA TODAY Sports The team of Nathan Adrian, Ryan Held, Michael Phelps and Caeleb Dressel won gold in the men's 4x100-meter freestyle relay. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Michael Phelps won the gold in the men's 200-meter butterfly. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports David Boudia and Steele Johnson brought home silver in 10-meter platform synchronized diving. David E. Klutho, USA TODAY Sports Cody Miller claimed bronze in the men's 100-meter breaststroke. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Maya DiRado claimed silver in the women's 400-meter IM. Erich Schlegel, USA TODAY Sports Corey Cogdell took bronze in women's trap. Matt Kryger, USA TODAY Sports The team of Brady Ellison, and Zach Garrett and Jake Kaminski won silver in archery. Christopher Hanewinckel, USA TODAY Sports Dana Vollmer took the bronze medal in the women's 100-meter butterfly. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports The team of Simone Manuel, Abbey Weitzeil, Dana Vollmer and Katie Ledecky captured silver in the women's 4x100-meter freestyle relay. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Kristin Armstrong won gold in the women's road cycling time trial, her third consecutive gold in the event. Jack Gruber, USA TODAY Sports Katie Ledecky captured gold and Leah Smith took bronze in the women's 400-meter freestyle. Rob Schumacher, USA TODAY Sports Ryan Murphy, right, took the gold medal while David Plummer brought home a bronze in the men's 100-meter backstroke. Her jaw dropped as she looked up to the scoreboard and saw a tie for gold and an Olympic-record time of 52.70 seconds. A FINA official confirmed that Manuel is the first African American woman to win Olympic gold in an individual event. Penny Oleksiak of Canada shared the gold. Sweden's Sarah Sjostrom won bronze. The last time an American woman won gold in the event was 1984, when Nancy Hogshead and Carrie Steinseifer also tied. This is the first tie for a gold medal since Anthony Ervin and Gary Hall Jr. did it in the 50 free in Sydney in 2000. American Abbey Weitzeil was seventh. Loading...
